ggit.entities module

Blob

class ggit.entities.blob.Blob(content: bytes)

This class represent a BLOB (Binary Large OBject), a blob stores the contents of a file without keeping track of its metadata. In git, a blob is identified by it’s sha1 hash, calculated by concatenating the string “blob “, an integer representing the size of the file in bytes, followed by a NUL character, ending with the actual content of the file.

content

The content of the blob.

Type

bytes

length

The length of the blob.

Type

int

hash

The hash of the blob.

Type

str

Parameters

content (bytes) – The content of the blob.

Tree

class ggit.entities.tree.Tree(_Tree__items: List[Tuple[ggit.entities.blob.Blob | ggit.entities.tree.Tree, str, str]] = [])

This class represents a TREE object, an entity that abstracts a directory, it can stores blobs and other trees. The main goal of the tree is to associate a filename and a mode to blobs and other trees. The file and directory modes are the same as UNIX file modes, but these are less flexible, the only available modes are:

  • 100644: regular file, read/write permission

  • 100755: regular file, read/write permission, execute permission

  • 120000: symbolic link

  • 040000: directory

items

The items of the tree, a list of tuples containing the item, its name and the mode.

Type

List[Tuple[ggit.entities.blob.Blob | ggit.entities.tree.Tree, str, str]]

hash

The hash of the tree.

Type

str

content

The content of the tree, the actual string of bytes that will be hashed.

Type

bytes

length

The length of the tree content.

Type

int

item_count

The number of items in the tree, recursively, counting the tree itself

Type

int

append_item(item: ggit.entities.blob.Blob | ggit.entities.tree.Tree, name: str, mode: str)

Append a blob or tree to the tree.

Parameters

  • item (Blob | Tree) – The item to append.

  • name (str) – The name of the item.

  • mode (str) – The mode of the item.

Commit

class ggit.entities.commit.Commit(tree: Tree = None, parent: Commit | None = None, date_time: datetime = None, author: User = None, committer: User = None, message: str = None)

This class represents a commit, it contains the main tree that mirrors the staging area, the author, the committer and the message of the commit. The commit class also stores the parent of the commit, if the commit is the first commit of the repository the parent is None. The hash of the commit is calculated in a similar way as the tree hash, hashing a string containing the word “commit ” followed by the size of the body terminated by a NUL character, followed by the body of the commit. The body of the commit is a string containing information about the commit, the format is:

tree ff7ae585339f04217663bdb7f54df531c6fb8217 author NameOfAuthor <email@example.com> 1662040308 +0200 committer NameOfCommitter <email@example.com> 1662040308 +0200

commit message

tree

The main tree of the commit.

Type

Tree

parent

The parent of the commit, if the commit is the first commit of the repository the parent is None.

Type

Commit | None

date_time

The date and time of the commit.

Type

datetime

str_date_time

The date and time of the commit in a string format. Format: UNIX-timestamp +0000

Type

str

author

The author of the commit.

Type

User

committer

The committer of the commit.

Type

User

message

The message of the commit.

Type

str

hash

The hash of the commit.

Type

str

content

The content of the commit, the content is the body of the commit.

Type

str

length

The length of the content of the commit.

Type

int
